alert.note: Alert for Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 04 at 1:46PM MDT until September 04 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 421... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 421... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 421. * WIND...West to northwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...8 to 10 percent. * HAINES...6. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. The combination of gusty winds, low relative humidity, and very warm temperatures will contribute to extreme fire behavior.
